revised_title: Ice Core Analysis and Climatic Change in the Devensian Cold Stage
tldr: This article discusses the analysis of ice cores from various locations to understand the environmental and climatic changes that occurred during the Devensian (Last) cold stage. The authors examine ice cores from Camp Century, Greenland, and Bird Station, Antarctica, and discuss the challenges in interpreting isotopic data and dating ice cores. They find evidence of warmer climate conditions before the onset of the last ice age and identify periods of colder conditions throughout the Devensian stage.
